More recently, last October 2, 2021, he was among those recognized as UE’s 75 Most Outstanding Alumni on the occasion of the University’s 75th Foundation Anniversary.
On UE’s end, Sen. Jaworski was awarded by the University as one of its Diamond Jubilee Alumni Achievers on the occasion of UE’s 60th Foundation Anniversary in 2006.
His playing number was retired in a fitting tribute ceremony in 2012.

The commemorative stamps set is the latest in a long list of accolades that Sen. Jaworski has received in his career. He was named as one of the PBA’s 40 greatest players and was inducted into the PBA Hall of Fame in 2005.

Upon his retirement, the esteemed UE alumnus ran and won as a Philippine Senator in the 1998 National Elections as an independent candidate. As a senator, he authored and co-authored over 300 bills, including the Clean Air Act and the Solid Waste Management Act.
He would continue being a playing coach for Ginebra until 1998, when he retired from the PBA.

In 1984, he became part of the Ginebra San Miguel Team in the PBA, where he was best known. "The Big J," as he was popularly known, became the team’s coach in 1985, while still playing for the league.
The future senator would become part of the Philippine Basketball Association (PBA) upon its establishment in 1975, when Toyota would transfer to the league.
He joined the Manila Industrial and Commercial Athletic Association (MICAA) tournaments as part of the Yco Painters in 1967, Meralco in 1968, and Toyota in 1971.
The following year, he was among those chosen to represent the country in the 1967 Asian Basketball Championship in Seoul, South Korea, where the Philippine team clinched the gold medal.
In 1966, he was selected to be a part of the Philippine basketball team sent to play in the 1966 Asian Games in Bangkok, Thailand.
He was part of the UE Team that won the UAAP Men’s Basketball Championship in 1965 and 1966, starting UE’s record 7-peat string of UAAP Men’s Basketball Crowns.
started his long, illustrious basketball career as part of the UE Red Warriors Men’s Basketball Team in the University Athletic Association of the Philippines.
Sen. Jaworski, who earned his Bachelor of Science in Business Administration degree from the UE College of Business Administration-Manila in 1967,

The said unveiling also marked the launch of “Salamat, Pagpupugay sa mga Alamat,” a three-part collection of stamp issuances featuring "Living Legends, Outstanding Filipinos and Never Forgotten Icons" who have made a mark in their chosen fields here and abroad.
The Post Office launched the Philippine’s first stamp, bearing the inauguration of the Philippine Republic, in 1946—coincidentally, the birth year of Sen. Jaworski and of the University of the East.
The commemorative stamp is part of PhilPost’s celebration of the country’s first stamp, which is celebrating its 75th year. https://t.co/gGnW2nRLN7

The unveiling ceremony was held last Saturday, October 16, 2021, at the Philippine Post Office at Liwasang Bonifacio in Manila. Sen. Jaworski is the first UE alumnus to be accorded the honor of being immortalized in a Philippine stamp. https://t.co/AcnVwIK9qn
for being honored by the Philippine Postal Corporation (PhilPost) with a set of nine commemorative stamps!

In addition to Roughcut, 'Balay na ‘Ko' is part of the One Minute Collection, an assortment of 15,000 videos of exactly a minute from 120 countries, as preserved by The Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision.
and curates regular film challenges in collaboration with Falmouth University.

Based in Cornwall, England, O-Region is a multi-faceted production company whose work spans theatre, film and events. The company has produced and toured original theatre work across small-scale and rural venues, and has also produced feature-length and short-form films,

Per its website, Roughcut, which is organized primarily by O-Region in association with the School of Film and Television in Falmouth University, challenges filmmakers to create a film of any genre no longer than 60 secs, including the end credits, inspired by the theme of “home”
As the Audience Choice Awardee, “Balay na 'Ko” won for its team a £250 cash prize.

The film’s mother character is played by Floideth L. Magalang, a 2002 Bachelor of Science in Business Administration graduate of the UE College of Business Administration-Manila, while the child is played by Stephen Yrone Guce.
and musical scorer Jan Casey B. Inocencio, an April 2019 Humanities and Social Sciences Strand graduate of the UE Basic Education Department-Caloocan.

The film was directed by third-year UE BA Comm student John Harvey H. Guce, from a screenplay by fellow third-year UE BA Comm student Chelsey Denisse Borja. Among the other behind-the-scenes personnel are editor and UE BA Comm junior Maxine Janel B. Lavilla,
Through 'Balay na ‘Ko', they say that home is not a place but a feeling, as it tells the story of a mother's longing.

'Balay na ‘Ko's' is a passion project by the team, who have long been fascinated by the art of filmmaking. With the pandemic and lockdown, the film has been their creative outlet, and a source of calm amid chaos and uncertainy.

The short film, which will be awarded online on October 14, 2021, is among the competition’s 60 finalists from all over the world. The contest, whose simple theme is "home," was opened on May 7, 2021, with those shortlisted notified on September 1, 2021.
has won the Audience Choice award in O-Region’s Roughcut 60-Second Film Challenge!

Rest in peace, Warrior graduate and former UE CBA Manila Dean Sevilla, and thank you for your service to UE...

[With info and images from Nitz M. Cardenas-Mata and Paul Richard S. Muncada]

Dean Sevilla also envisioned UE CBA Manila’s achievement of Philippine Association of Colleges and Universities Commission on Accreditation (PACUCOA) Level III Accredited Status by upgrading the College’s faculty profile.
During his term as UE CBA Manila Dean, Dean Sevilla spearheaded the creation of the UE Accounting Lecture Series and the Professorial Chair for the improvement of the College’s faculty members.

On the academic front, Dean Sevilla was an accounting instructor at Oregon State University from 1967 to 1968 and 1973 to 1975, and Associate Professor of Accounting at the UP College of Business Administration.

the design and implementation of a modern accounting system for the national government of Indonesia. He had also worked as a Director of External Audit of the United Nations Board of Auditors from 1984 to 1988.

He was also the team leader for the implementation of a new accounting system of the Philippine National Railways, for the preparation of an audit manual of the Development Bank of the Philippines, and for
Dean Sevilla served as a partner in the Management Services Division of Arthur Andersen & Co. from 1961 to 1964, 1978 to 1984, and 1988 to 1999.

He also managed to be a candidate for a doctoral degree in Business Administration, major in Business Quantitative Methods, minor in Accounting, Production Management, and Business and its Environment, in 1967.
He went on to finish his Master of Arts, major in Business Quantitative Methods, from the University of Washington in 1965.
He graduated from UE CBA Manila in 1961 with the degree of Bachelor of Business Administration, major in Accounting, Magna Cum Laude. He took and topped the CPA Board Exam of that year.
Dean Sevilla served as UE CBA Manila Dean from 2003 to 2004. He had also served as UE CBA Manila Vice Dean and faculty member within 1968 to 1973.

Kailanman, huwag kalimutan ang kasaysayan upang ito ay hindi na muling maulit pa. Hindi maituturing na bayani ang isang tao na may bakas ng dugo ng mga inosente at nag sadlak sa bansang ito. 

Diktador, hindi bayani. 

#NEVERFORGET
Inaanyayahan ang lahat na makiisa  sa pagmumulat, at maging susi sa kinabukasang totoo at tapat. Ito ang magpapatunay na walang nakalimot, at walang makakalimot.
Nabulag man ang iba sa mga maling impormasyong lumalaganap, hindi ito hadlang sa patuloy na paghangad ng katotohanan.

Maraming taon man ang lumipas, hindi mawawala ang markang ginawa nito sa bayan. Ang pagdiriwang nito ay magsisilbing pag-alala sa mga taong hanggang sa kasalulukuyan ay wala paring nakakamit na hustisya.
Ang bansa ay nasadlak sa kahirapan dahil sa pagkamkam ng kaban ng bayan at pagpapalubog sa bansa sa utang na hanggang sa ngayon ay ating pinapasan.

Sa pag-diriwang ng ika-49 taon ng Martial Law, inaalala ng bawat Pilipino ang madilim na parte ng kasaysayan. Sa panahon ng Martial Law, isang daang libong Pilipino at higit pa ay inabuso, inapakan ang karapatan, at kinitil ang mga buhay. https://t.co/DCKZ5RucQa

#MasPinalaCAS
#NoStudentLeftBehind
#LetTheStudentsBeHeard

Ito ay hindi lamang usapin ukol sa paglulunsad ng klase at kung sino lamang ang makakayahang tumugon sa akademikong pangangailangan, ito rin ay isyu ng seguridad at kaligtasan ng mga mag-aaral sa gitna ng krisis na ating kinahaharap.

Ang edukasyon ay isang karapatang dapat nating natatamasa at hindi pribilehiyo para lamang sa iilan. Kung kaya’t marapat lamang na bigyan tugon ng Pamantasaan ang mga hinaing ng mga mag-aaral at muling suriin ang kanilang desisyon kung saan lahat ay makikinabang at walang maiiwan
sa pansamantalang pagkawala ng kabuhayan ng kanilang pamilya at pagkaparalisa ng pantustos sa araw-araw na pangangailangan.

lalo na ang mga estudyanteng umuwi sa kani-kanilang mga tahanan sa probinsya.

Sa gitna ng pandemyang krisis na kinahaharap ng ating bansa sa kasalukuyan, patuloy na humaharap sa samu’t saring suliranin ang ating mga mamamayan—mayroon din sa ating mag-aaral ang nahihirapan dahil

Ang pagsasagawa ng maagang pagbubukas ng klase na ginagamitan ng modernong teknolohiya ay hindi makatarungan sapagkat marami sa ating mga mag-aaral ang hindi makasasabay dulot ng kawalan ng disenteng akses sa internet at sapat na kagamitan,
Ang hakbang na ito ay taliwas sa pananaw ng Pamantasan na makapagbigay sa mga mag-aaral ng dekalidad at mahusay na edukasyon sa abot-kayang halaga.

Kaisa ang Konseho ng Mag-aaral ng Agham at Sining sa pagkondena sa naging desisyon ng Pamantasan ng Silangan sa modernong pagbubukas ng klase na nakatakdang magsimula sa Agosto 5. https://t.co/0aNWU1bCTo

The strongest weapon of a democratic country is its right to peaceful suffrage, voting for their leaders of whom they think and wish to embody their ideals and aspirations for the future of their motherland.

On this day, the Political Science Society sends their deepest appreciation and warmest greeting to Pres. Patricia Caballero on her birthday!
Her willingness to listen first before talking has become a well-known trait of her as a friend of every PolSci student of the university.

Ms. Caballero is also a student, and as a leader of her own, she is known as someone who cares about what other people have to say, always keeping an ear or two to their rants, complaints, appreciation, concerns, and of all, a call for help.

The way our very own president became a leader is through her own efforts and everything she endured as a person and as a student, and her leadership resonates to the younger members of the organization for them to become leaders of their own.
Her leadership for the past few years under the office of the organization has been evident, with projects and events being done and people being helped counts to tens, if not hundreds.
One such example is the Political Science Society’s very own chief, President Patricia Francesca M. Caballero.
Being someone who is in charge of a group of people is something anyone can do, but being a leader is different from it for leaders are trained by time and honed by experience.

Nananawagan ang organisasyong ito sa Pamahalaan para sa karagdagang seguridad at agarang pagtugon sa mga banta at babala na nagdudulot ng panganib sa mga buhay ng mga abogado ng bayan.

Nakikiisa rin ang Lipunan ng Agham Pampolitika sa mga laban at paninindigan ng mga abogado ng bayan na tumatayo para sa bawat Pilipinong nakikipaglaban sa pagtamasa ng karapatan at pagkakapantay-pantay.

sa isang ligtas na balik eskwela. Ito rin ay simbolo ng pakikiisa na maisulong ang agarang pagpapatupad ng mass testing at mass vaccination upang mas mapaigting pa ang pagpuksa ng bansa laban sa COVID-19.

Ang Lipunan ng Agham Pampulitika ay nakikiisa sa Konseho ng Mag-aaral ng Kolehiyo ng Agham at Sining sa paglaban sa patas, pang-masa, at makataong pamamahala, sa matibay at pinaigting na paggamit ng kalayaan, sa kalidad at abot-kayang edukasyon, gayundin ang pagpapanukala...

Mabuhay ka, Gat. Jose Rizal, at magdiwang para sa iyong ika-160 kaarawan!

mula sa kanilang mananakop. Ang mga kathang ito na pawang si Gat. Rizal ang nag-akda ang siyang nagsilbing pangunang kislap na nagliyab sa makabansang puso at magiting na kabayanihan ng lahat ng mga Pilipinong nag-alsa para sa paglaya ng Pilipinas.

Natatangi nga ang isa sa pinakatanyag na bayani ng ating bansa na si Gat. Jose Rizal sapagkat ang kanyang pakikidigma ay naganap sa pamamagitan ng pagsusulat ng propaganda’t kathang literatura na hango sa hindi patas at hindi makatarungang ganap na nararanasan ng mga Pilipino...

Ngunit hindi lamang sa digmaang lubos ang ating naging laban para sa ating paglaya, ang mga bayaning Pilipino rin ay lumaban sa pamamaraan ng kanilang katalinuhan at kakayahan sa sining, literatura, agham at iba pa.
Ang kabayanihan na ito ay madalas na makikita sa lugar ng digmaan sa pamamagitan ng mga Pilipinong matatapang na sumugpo sa sandatahang lakas ng mga mananakop ng bansa.

Bilang isang Pilipino, kagitingan ang ipinapakita sa salita at sa gawa ng mga bayani ng bayan. Sila ang nagtaguyod ng Republika na ating ngayong pinangangalagaan at ng kasarinlan mula sa mga kolonyal at imperyalistang mga bansa na atin ngayong natatamasa. https://t.co/BFJVXZ1mUf

The ASEAN Future Sustainable Leaders 2021 (A-FSL) is an online case competition in which groups of students from secondary and tertiary education had provided ideas on multidisciplinary to solve issues related to the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals.

The group presented the PROJECT EMBRACE which stands for Emphasis on Broader Access, a sustainable social network of stakeholders to foster effective partnerships for the achievement of SDGs not just the SDG 17. (You can watch their video here: https://t.co/9DOqESBYdq)
Their video presentation was entitled "Why effective partnerships is the answer to the SDGs" focusing on SDG 17 Partnership for the Goals, specifically Target 17.17 Effective Partnerships.

with the guidance of their Coach Prof. Lindley Mesina together with Prof. Josiah Barrameda and Prof. Luigi Dimaunahan, was awarded as the 3rd Runner Up for the first A-FSL 21 Case Competition Philippine Qualifiers.

The CBASC congratulates the BA Warriors who represented the University of the East - Manila in the recently concluded Asean Future Sustainable Leaders (A-FSL 21) Case Competition.

As we celebrate World Teacher’s Day this October 5, 2021, we at the University of the East Psychological Society would also like to extend our gratitude and acknowledgment to all of the teachers worldwide. We hope that your kindness and passion to hone our skills remain ignited!

To our beloved teachers who do not need to wear caps to be heroes, we thank you for the love, sacrifices, and hard works that you bring to us. Indeed, all of our teachers go above and beyond the call of their duty to mold students to be better and provide us promising future.

all of you persevered by adjusting and acquiring new skills for teaching.

Not only you do ensure that learning and imparting necessary skills never stop amid the pandemic, but you also provide us the utmost understanding and emotional guidance we need nowadays.

Regardless of the challenges posed by the prolonged health crisis and distance learning, we can still feel your warm presence and kindness. 

Even though you bump into seemingly infinite adjustments and hassles currently,

No projects and achievements can erase the solitary confinement, sleep deprivation, forced stripping, electric shocks, strangulation, food deprivation, rape, molestation, extrajudicial killings, massacres, and corruption that every Filipinos experienced during this regime.

Several infrastructures, road, bridges, and projects were spearheaded, but 106,240 people were violated. 

All of this were made by one person that will remain unforgettable to every single Filipinos.

The economy of the Philippines rose with a GDP of 19.3 Billion Pesos, but 501.05 Billion pesos was stolen from the Filipinos. 

NLEX was made and now transports 200,000 motorists per day, but around 10,000 Moro Muslim won't be able to use this.

Maharlika Highway was made with a length of 3,380 to able to travel freely, but 70,000 people were stripped out of freedom without a notice. 

Basic training was provided 482 scientists, doctors, engineers, but the right to information was banished from 484 media outlets.

On September 21, 1972, the Philippines was tormented. 

The 2,164 meter San Juanico Bridge was built, but 3,240 lives was destroyed. 

Philippine Heart Center that aids 14,000 people was founded, but 34,000 people was tortured.

‘OYAYI’ REIMAGINES CLASSIC TUNES TO CRYPTIC TALES 

In celebration of Buwan ng Wika, Teatro ni Juan presents their reinterpretation of classic Filipino folk songs and nursery rhymes to contemporary narratives with "OYAYI: Tinig ng mga Hiraya't Pagkarahuyo".
